issue.title: Time Line enhancements - full support of time values as intervals
issue.body:
For multidimensional Layers, marked as multidimensional in Geoserver, when time dimension is enabled it is possible to select an Attribute and an End Attribute, only Attribute is currently considered by MapStore when setting up the TimeLine component, as a consequence it is not entirely possible to analyse time based domains data in a range between Attribute and End Attribute. The time analysis is performed on single 'punctual' time values along the time line. The objective that we want to accomplish is to have 'time intervals' represented data on the timeline, this means time will no longer be only a time instant in timeline but it could also be managed as a time range, an interval between `Attribute` and `End Attribute` for each record of the multidimensional attribute, in this specific case time.

Freshdesk original ticket: http://vlaanderen.geo-solutions.it/support/tickets/46980)

The implementation of this new approach to time based layer analysis will have implications:

1. How the timeline component will display the histograms representing the data occurrences for each time interval in the total time range. (front-end)
2. How to compute histograms when we have time interval analysis rather than time instants values (back-end)
3. How to handle the different response from the server when the analysis is based on time intervals (front-end)

Moreover, in details the implications regarding the front-end implementations will have to take into account different user/data cases scenarios that will be collected in the issues within this epic (i.e. overlapping intervals, time range analysis window snapping, etc.) 

# Acceptance criteria

- [x] As a user I want to add to the map a layer from a GeoServer **with WMTS Multidim extension** that is configured with start and end attributes for time dimension. 
- [x] When I add the layer the timeline plugins shows the values of values of time intervals for the layer as horizontal bars. If the time intervals overlap the timeline section dedicated to the layer should expand vertically to allow a vertical stacking of the bars, in order to show all the values clearly.
- [x] When I click on the timeline with the snapping active, the cursor will be placed to the nearest time that is a **start point or an end point** of the interval.  
- [x] The animations and the forward-backward buttons (with snap to layer active) will snap to **start time** and **end time** of each interval, according to user choice. 
- [x] If more that 20 elements are present in the same layer for the given interval, the histogram will be shown instead (as it is now). 

![timeline-intervals1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1279510/159245595-3dbf4f33-040f-41b7-a308-189c10674140.jpg)


# Other related tasks 
- Back-end work to return intervals from start/end attribute https://github.com/geosolutions-it/support/issues/1943

# Analysis and development considerations

## Snap and Animation

Snap and animation now work with DescribeDomains calls. Support to interval from the back-end (and possible interval values returned by the service) should be supported and parsed by the client to provide both the functionalities as they are working now. We need to define a policy for snapping to intervals and selecting the animations time values. These are the possibilities: 


**Snap:**
1.  snap start time, without any configuration. 
2.  snap to start or end time (nearest).
3.  snap to the center of the interval.
4.  snap to start, center or end (configurable from UI). 


For the moment we should "snap to **start or end** time of the interval (2nd point)" leaving space for the evolution of this. 

**Animation**:

In case of animation, snapping on start time seems to be the simplest solution to support time intervals. For the moment we should support this. Other options should be configurable (e.g. center, end).

## Backend service

The WMTS multidim extension must support time interval (this has a separate issue for GeoServer). 

It is important that the back-end service **must** return the values even if the start-end are outside the range requested but the interval overlaps the interval requested. This to properly show the time values on the timeline.

## UI 

Multiple interval occurrences may  have 'overlapping' time intervals, these could be represented with stacked time interval bars, this design may also require to change the height of the timeline component to accommodate the vertically stacked interval bars, height could be dynamic, according to the number of occurrences of interval for a given time instant.

## Performances

Now there is a limit of 20 items per layer to limit the rendering of timeline and avoid perfomance issues due to the continuous re-rendering of the items. 

We could keep this limit with the new interface.

issue.title: 7958 timeline intervals support
issue.body:
## Description
This PR implements the enhancement to support multidimensional time dimension layers with 'time intervals' represented data on the timeline, this means the time dimension for every single feature will be managed as a time range, an interval between `Attribute` and `End Attribute` for each record of the multidimensional attribute, in this specific case time.

**Please check if the PR fulfills these requirements**
- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/geosolutions-it/MapStore2/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
- [x] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [ ] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)


**What kind of change does this PR introduce?** (check one with "x", remove the others)
 - [ ] Bugfix
 - [x] Feature
 - [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
 - [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
 - [ ] Build related changes
 - [ ] CI related changes
 - [ ] Other... Please describe:

<!-- add here the ReadTheDocs link (if needed) -->

## Issue

**What is the current behavior?**
#7958 
Multidimensional layers with time can only be shown on the timeline component as 'instants', on the time line these 'instants' are represented as  dots with neither start nor end date. 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14953970/168089775-d15ae038-83ef-408c-b411-40c15374d55b.png)

**What is the new behavior?**
Multidimensional layers with time can only be shown on the timeline component as 'intervals', on the time line these 'intervals' are represented as extended lines which edges represent their start and end date. All functionalities that were based on the time dates such as snapping, animation and buttons playback have been redesigned to support start/end date of each interval see


![recording_1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14953970/168091591-a804bc0a-df88-4566-a43b-8d69ca2e6c8e.gif)

## Breaking change
**Does this PR introduce a breaking change?** (check one with "x", remove the other)
 - [ ] Yes, and I documented them in migration notes
 - [x] No

<!-- If this PR contains a breaking change, please describe the impact and migration path for existing applications -->

## Other useful information
This PR enhancement was originally designed following a customer support request 
http://vlaanderen.geo-solutions.it/support/tickets/46980

issue.body:
For multidimensional Layers, marked as multidimensional in Geoserver, when time dimension is enabled it is possible to select an Attribute and an End Attribute, only Attribute is currently considered by MapStore when setting up the TimeLine component, as a consequence it is not entirely possible to analyse time based domains data in a range between Attribute and End Attribute. 1. How the timeline component will display the histograms representing the data occurrences for each time interval in the total time range. (front-end)
2. How to compute histograms when we have time interval analysis rather than time instants values (back-end)
3. How to handle the different response from the server when the analysis is based on time intervals (front-end)

- Back-end work to return intervals from start/end attribute https://github.com/geosolutions-it/support/issues/1943

In case of animation, snapping on start time seems to be the simplest solution to support time intervals. For the moment we should support this. Other options should be configurable (e.g. center, end).

The WMTS multidim extension must support time interval (this has a separate issue for GeoServer).

issue.title: Timeline - Disable Time interval for a layer with 'instants'
issue.body:
Related to this https://github.com/geosolutions-it/MapStore2/issues/7958#issue-1168680480 when the timeline of the layer with 'instants' (ex: Meteorite_Landings_from_NASA_Open_Data_Portal) the Time interval snap point should
be disabled because selecting the End, the animation option does not work.


**How to Reproduce**
- Open [this map](https://dev-mapstore.geosolutionsgroup.com/mapstore/#/viewer/openlayers/39497)
- Follows the steps in the gif below:
![connseerioni_unmiss.gif](https://images.zenhubusercontent.com/5da5b30f66de7b0001e4e77c/9e960439-32df-486b-b8e4-6162a0672e56)


**Current Result**
The animation does not work

commits.message: Porting changes from #7881 partially to make standard print option configurable from localConfig/context. (#8205)

pull_request.title: Porting part of the changes from #7881 to the target branch to make standard print items configurable using localConfig/ print plugin config in context
pull_request.body:
## Description
Title is pretty descriptive. #7881 was merged only to the master and it is missing in 2022.01.xx that was a source branch for 2022.01.xx-geOrchestra. That PR contains minor but important change that makes it's possible to override default configuration of standard print item with config passed via localConfig or print plugin configuration inside of the context.
This item also solves issue when overlayLayers checkbox was incorrectly put into accordion list upon resolving merge conflict.

**Please check if the PR fulfills these requirements**
- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/geosolutions-it/MapStore2/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
- [ ] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [ ] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)


**What kind of change does this PR introduce?** (check one with "x", remove the others)
 - [x] Bugfix
 - [ ] Feature
 - [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
 - [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
 - [ ] Build related changes
 - [ ] CI related changes
 - [ ] Other... Please describe:

<!-- add here the ReadTheDocs link (if needed) -->

## Issue

**What is the current behavior?**
Overlay layers are missing on geOrchestra because of the missing support of

**What is the new behavior?**
Visibility option can be overridden in localConfig/context properly

## Breaking change
**Does this PR introduce a breaking change?** (check one with "x", remove the other)
 - [ ] Yes, and I documented them in migration notes
 - [x] No

<!-- If this PR contains a breaking change, please describe the impact and migration path for existing applications -->

## Other useful information

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,126 @@
+# GeoServer Helm Chart
+
+## Helm Chart Installation
+
+1) Clone the helm chart repo
+
+```bash
+git clone https://github.com/geosolutions-it/charts.git
+```
+
+2) Within the root of the helm chart, create a custom `values.yaml` file
+
+```bash
+cp geoserver/v0.1.0/values.yaml geoserver/v0.1.0/custom-values.yaml
+```
+
+3) Edit sample `context.xml` to add as many JNDI datasources are needed. The sample `context.xml` contains by default the JNDI datasource for the embedded postgis service that can be enabled in `values.yaml`. Example:
+
+```xml
+<Context>
+
+    <!-- Default set of monitored resources -->
+    <WatchedResource>WEB-INF/web.xml</WatchedResource>
+
+    <!-- Uncomment this to disable session persistence across Tomcat restarts -->
+    <!--
+    <Manager pathname="" />
+    -->
+
+    <!-- Uncomment this to enable Comet connection tacking (provides events
+         on session expiration as well as webapp lifecycle) -->
+    <!--
+    <Valve className="org.apache.catalina.valves.CometConnectionManagerValve" />
+    -->
+
+    <Resource
+     name="jdbc/postgres" auth="Container" type="javax.sql.DataSource"
+     driverClassName="org.postgresql.Driver"
+     url="jdbc:postgresql://127.0.0.1:5432/geoserver"
+     username="geoserver" password="geoserver"
+     initialSize="0" maxActive="20" maxIdle="5" maxWait="2000" minIdle="0"
+     timeBetweenEvictionRunsMillis="30000"
+     minEvictableIdleTimeMillis="60000"
+     validationQuery="SELECT 1"
+     maxAge="600000"
+     rollbackOnReturn="true"
+     />
+</Context>
+```
comment.body: Make it an optional step after the initial deployment. PostgreSQL is disabled by default

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,126 @@
+# GeoServer Helm Chart
+
+## Helm Chart Installation
+
+1) Clone the helm chart repo
+
+```bash
+git clone https://github.com/geosolutions-it/charts.git
+```
+
+2) Within the root of the helm chart, create a custom `values.yaml` file
+
+```bash
+cp geoserver/v0.1.0/values.yaml geoserver/v0.1.0/custom-values.yaml
+```
+
+3) Edit sample `context.xml` to add as many JNDI datasources are needed. The sample `context.xml` contains by default the JNDI datasource for the embedded postgis service that can be enabled in `values.yaml`. Example:
+
+```xml
+<Context>
+
+    <!-- Default set of monitored resources -->
+    <WatchedResource>WEB-INF/web.xml</WatchedResource>
+
+    <!-- Uncomment this to disable session persistence across Tomcat restarts -->
+    <!--
+    <Manager pathname="" />
+    -->
+
+    <!-- Uncomment this to enable Comet connection tacking (provides events
+         on session expiration as well as webapp lifecycle) -->
+    <!--
+    <Valve className="org.apache.catalina.valves.CometConnectionManagerValve" />
+    -->
+
+    <Resource
+     name="jdbc/postgres" auth="Container" type="javax.sql.DataSource"
+     driverClassName="org.postgresql.Driver"
+     url="jdbc:postgresql://127.0.0.1:5432/geoserver"
+     username="geoserver" password="geoserver"
+     initialSize="0" maxActive="20" maxIdle="5" maxWait="2000" minIdle="0"
+     timeBetweenEvictionRunsMillis="30000"
+     minEvictableIdleTimeMillis="60000"
+     validationQuery="SELECT 1"
+     maxAge="600000"
+     rollbackOnReturn="true"
+     />
+</Context>
+```
+
+Concerning the security context of pod and pv(s), it is recommended not to comment out this section, because the docker image runs natively as non root, althogh the id or gid of `1000` can be changed to anything else and they can be differnt values, in case the infrastructure requires different ID/GID mapping:
+
+```yml
+podSecurityContext:
+  fsGroup: 1000
+
+securityContext:
+  runAsNonRoot: true
+  runAsUser: 1000
+```
+
+Once the `custom-values.yaml` is ready and suits the configuration needs, the helm chart can be deployed like this:
+
+```bash
+cd geoserver/v0.1.0
+helm3 install geoserver . --values ./custom-values.yaml
+```
+
+Once configured you will be promped with the geoserver final URL with the customized hostname (dns records are not handled by the chart) served by the k8s ingress.
+
+## Notes on GeoServer configuration
+
+### Admin password change
+
+You can put a custom password at installation time, so it is not the default which is `notgeoserver` and it is *different* from war's default that is `geoserver`.
+If you want to change the password you can do it via [REST API](https://docs.geoserver.org/stable/en/user/rest/api/selfadmin.html) or with the GeoServer UI:
+
+- Click on the left, under Security section, "Users,Groups, and Roles"
+- Click on Users/Groups tab, then click on admin user
+- Edit the password and save.
+
+### Specific configuration options for GeoServer
+
+The default directory structure, possibility to add plugins to the GeoServer war file, enable/disable [JAI extension](https://docs.geoserver.org/master/en/user/configuration/image_processing/index.html), enable or disable [CSRF (Cross-Site Request Forgery)](https://docs.geoserver.org/stable/en/user/security/webadmin/csrf.html),configure tomcat's `Xmx` maximum memory allocation pool and `Xms` or tomcat's initial memory allocation pool.
+
+```yml
+geoserver:
+  # space separated list of plugin URLs (see also this possibility below to format such string)
+  # plugins: "https://sourceforge.net/projects/geoserver/files/GeoServer/2.20.4/extensions/geoserver-2.20.4-monitor-plugin.zip \
+  #   https://sourceforge.net/projects/geoserver/files/GeoServer/2.20.4/extensions/geoserver-2.20.4-control-flow-plugin.zip"
+  # to enable audit logging once the pod is deployed go inside the geoserver pod and configure it in the datadir according to doc:
+  # https://docs.geoserver.org/latest/en/user/extensions/monitoring/audit.html
+  plugins: ""
+  geoserver_log_location: "/var/geoserver/logs/$(POD_HOSTNAME).log"
+  geoserver_audit_path: "/var/geoserver/audits"
+  geoserver_heap_dump_dir: "/var/geoserver/memory_dumps"
+  geoserver_data_dir: "/var/geoserver/datadir"
+  geoserver_cache_data_dir: "$(GEOSERVER_DATA_DIR)/gwc_cache_dir"
+  geoserver_cache_config_dir: "$(GEOSERVER_DATA_DIR)/gwc"
+  geoserver_netcdf_data_dir: "/var/geoserver/netcdf_data_dir"
+  geoserver_grib_cache_dir: "/var/geoserver/grib_cache_dir"
+  geoserver_csrf_disabled: "true"
+  geoserver_jai_ext_enabled: "true"
+  geoserver_java_mem_xms: "4G"
+  geoserver_java_mem_xmx: "4G"
+```
+
+## Notes on specific clouds
+
+### AWS
+
+In case of deploying this chart on EKS the geoserver service will be most likely exposed with AWS's ingress of kind alb.
+When using `alb` as an ingress backend, the service must be exposed as `NodePort` and not `ClusterIP`, which is the more generic default.
comment.body: Why? is there an external reference that we can add here?

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,126 @@
+# GeoServer Helm Chart
+
+## Helm Chart Installation
+
+1) Clone the helm chart repo
+
+```bash
+git clone https://github.com/geosolutions-it/charts.git
+```
+
+2) Within the root of the helm chart, create a custom `values.yaml` file
+
+```bash
+cp geoserver/v0.1.0/values.yaml geoserver/v0.1.0/custom-values.yaml
+```
+
+3) Edit sample `context.xml` to add as many JNDI datasources are needed. The sample `context.xml` contains by default the JNDI datasource for the embedded postgis service that can be enabled in `values.yaml`. Example:
+
+```xml
+<Context>
+
+    <!-- Default set of monitored resources -->
+    <WatchedResource>WEB-INF/web.xml</WatchedResource>
+
+    <!-- Uncomment this to disable session persistence across Tomcat restarts -->
+    <!--
+    <Manager pathname="" />
+    -->
+
+    <!-- Uncomment this to enable Comet connection tacking (provides events
+         on session expiration as well as webapp lifecycle) -->
+    <!--
+    <Valve className="org.apache.catalina.valves.CometConnectionManagerValve" />
+    -->
+
+    <Resource
+     name="jdbc/postgres" auth="Container" type="javax.sql.DataSource"
+     driverClassName="org.postgresql.Driver"
+     url="jdbc:postgresql://127.0.0.1:5432/geoserver"
+     username="geoserver" password="geoserver"
+     initialSize="0" maxActive="20" maxIdle="5" maxWait="2000" minIdle="0"
+     timeBetweenEvictionRunsMillis="30000"
+     minEvictableIdleTimeMillis="60000"
+     validationQuery="SELECT 1"
+     maxAge="600000"
+     rollbackOnReturn="true"
+     />
+</Context>
+```
+
+Concerning the security context of pod and pv(s), it is recommended not to comment out this section, because the docker image runs natively as non root, althogh the id or gid of `1000` can be changed to anything else and they can be differnt values, in case the infrastructure requires different ID/GID mapping:
+
+```yml
+podSecurityContext:
+  fsGroup: 1000
+
+securityContext:
+  runAsNonRoot: true
+  runAsUser: 1000
+```
+
+Once the `custom-values.yaml` is ready and suits the configuration needs, the helm chart can be deployed like this:
+
+```bash
+cd geoserver/v0.1.0
+helm3 install geoserver . --values ./custom-values.yaml
+```
+
+Once configured you will be promped with the geoserver final URL with the customized hostname (dns records are not handled by the chart) served by the k8s ingress.
+
+## Notes on GeoServer configuration
+
+### Admin password change
+
+You can put a custom password at installation time, so it is not the default which is `notgeoserver` and it is *different* from war's default that is `geoserver`.

```suggestion
Concerning the security context of pod and pv(s), it is recommended not to comment out this section, because the docker image runs natively as non root, althogh the id or gid of `1000` can be changed to anything else and they can be differnt values, in case the infrastructure requires different ID/GID mapping:

```yml
podSecurityContext:
  fsGroup: 1000

securityContext:
  runAsNonRoot: true
  runAsUser: 1000
```
```

issue.title: Implement Test container for MapStore docker-compose stack
issue.body:
We would like to test MapStore docker images as part of our CI/CD pipelines. The idea is to complement the existing `docker-compose.override.yml` for MapStore with a `docker-compose.override.yml` definiing a "test" container.

This test container will have a dependency on mapstore to wait for complete mapstore startup and then make a set of test calls to MapStore endpoints (details below).

At the end of each docker image build, the pipeline will take care of spinning up the compose for mapstore with the newly created image as well as the testing container to test it and clean up the environment after the execution.

**The Pipeline**

The pipeline is to be implemented in the form of a Jenkins job on the [official build server](http://build.geosolutionsgroup.com/) and executed on a dedicated [Executor](https://www.jenkins.io/doc/book/glossary/) (not on the jenkins master)

To be executed at the end of a successful build of the mapstore docker image. See the [MapStore Dev Job](http://build.geosolutionsgroup.com/job/MapStore/job/MapStore2_Dev_Build/) for instance

**The Tests**

Dedicated docker container running a Python script to test MapStore endpoints. Dedicated PostgreSQL geostore database with preconfigured users and resources.

Mandatory tests:
As anonymous user, test access to resources:
- mapstore homepage
- map
- dashboard
- geostory
- thumbnail
- context
- datadir externalization

A s authenticated user (basic authentication) *:
- private map

Optional Tests
- users manager
- context manager
- embedded html for dashboards
- embedded html for geostory
- embedded html for maps

* we'll eventually need to configure mapstore to allow for basic auth

pull_request.title: #8202: Cesium ThirdParty libraries added to bundle
pull_request.body:
## Description
This PR adds `ThirdParty` libraries of cesium to webpack bundle. This adds `draco decoder` to parse certain 3d tiles

**Please check if the PR fulfills these requirements**
- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/geosolutions-it/MapStore2/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md

**What kind of change does this PR introduce?** (check one with "x", remove the others)
 - [x] Enhancement

## Issue

**What is the current behavior?**
#8202 

**What is the new behavior?**
The 3d tiles are parsed correctly and displayed in map

**Note for tester**
_Example_
1. Import this [map](https://github.com/geosolutions-it/MapStore2-C040/files/8563499/map.zip) and switch to 3d
2. Toggle layer visibility of `fortebegato` to view on map (the 3d tiles are not configured properly hence the position and offset issue, so kindly ignore)
3. Layer is visible on the 3d map and tiles are rendered 

## Breaking change
**Does this PR introduce a breaking change?** (check one with "x", remove the other)
 - [ ] Yes, and I documented them in migration notes
 - [x] No

<!-- If this PR contains a breaking change, please describe the impact and migration path for existing applications -->

## Other useful information
